sense.name: keep from being seen or perceived by others
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] CONCEAL NP2 (PP NP3)
sense.examples: Drug traffickers tried to conceal money in the door of this SUV. Arms enthusiasts celebrate their right to conceal handguns. For two years they concealed the criminal charges and minted imaginary money. Donna had never concealed her interest in dirty books.
